Description: Green glazed composition amuletic figure in the form of the goddess Taweret standing on a narrow rectangular base, with a suspension ring slightly projecting from the back. Broken and repaired at the foot. A chevron design incised before firing decorates the tail at the back.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Tell Dafana, "Qasr", east annex (C), chamber 2 or 3
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1888 / Tanis. Part II. Nebesheh (Am) and Defenneh (Tahpanhes) (p. 74 § 72, p. 111, pl. xli, 72)
Leclère and Spencer 2014 / Tell Dafana Reconsidered: The Archaeology of an Egyptian Frontier Town (p.40, p.45, p.63, p.180, pl.22)
Condition: fair - damage to head and feet ( glaze flaked off at the back of the head).
